Title: YOUR RIGHTS ARE ON TRIAL
Type: D ocument ary
Time: 29:30

Audience: General
Serial Number: 57-18
Release Date: Issue lU (April 7)
A series of 13 half-hour radio programs of authoritative discussions and
authentic dramatizations of recent high court opinions on constitutional
rights* produced by the University of Minnesota Radio Station KUOM* under
a grant from the Educational Television and Radio Center* in cooperation
with the National Association of Educational Broadcasters and the Univer¬
sity of Minnesota Law School. Consultant-commentators for the series
were Professors of Law Monrad Paulsen (Columbia University) and Charles
Alan Wright (University of Texas),- writer-producer, Fhillip Gelb (Univer¬
sity of Minnesota).
Program No. 1 - "The Case of the Stomach Pump Evidence" - Due Process
of Law.
Program No. 2 - "The Case of the Wireless Wiretap" - Wiretapping.
Program No. 3 - "The Case of the Psychiatrist's Questions" - Reasonable
interrogation.
Program No. I4 — "The Case of the California Bookie" — Legal search and
seizure.
Program No. 5 - “United States versus Often Lattimore" - Right to definite
charge.
Program No. 6 - "The Case of the Communists' Bail" - Fair bail.
Program No. 7 — u The Case of the Baltimore Radio Show" - Fair trial versus
free press.
Program No, 8 - "The Case of the Korean Killing" - Right to trial in
civilian court.
Program No. 9 - "The Case of Dr. Peters' Loyalty" - Right to face accusers.
Program No. 10 - "The Case of the Missing Lawyers" - Right to counsel.
Program No, 11 - "Eugene Dennis versus the United States" - Impartial jury.
Program No. 12 - "The Slochower Case" - Right to avoid self-incrimination.
Program No. 13 - "National Security versus Individual Rights".
Justice of the Supreme Court William 0. Douglas: Federal Judge Jerome
Frank, author of "Courts on Trial"; Gen. Telford Taylor* Chief Counsel
